N.Y. Comp. Codes R. & Regs. Tit. 15 ยง 19.10 - Indemnification

State Regulations

The commissioner of finance (city of New York) shall
indemnify and save harmless the Commissioner of Motor Vehicles (State of New

York) from and against any and all liability, damage, expense, cause of action, suits, claims, penalties or judgments arising from the administration and
collection of the tax as required by this agreement. The commissioner of
finance shall at its own cost and expense, defend any and all suits and actions
which may be brought against the Commissioner of Motor Vehicles, or in which
the Commissioner of Motor Vehicles may be impleaded with others, arising from
the administration and collection of the tax, and in the event of the failure
of the commissioner of finance so to do, the commissioner may, at the cost and
expense of the commissioner of finance and upon prior written notice to the
commissioner of finance, defend any and all such suits or actions and the
commissioner of finance shall satisfy, pay and discharge any and all judgments
that may be recovered against the Commissioner of Motor Vehicles in any such
suits or actions which may be brought against the Commissioner of Motor

Vehicles or in which the Commissioner of Motor Vehicles may be impleaded with
others, and in the event the commissioner of finance fails to pay the amount or
amounts for which the Commissioner of Motor Vehicles shall become liable as
aforesaid, the Commissioner of Motor Vehicles may pay the same, and the amount
or amounts so paid, with any interest and costs that may be due thereon, shall
be reimbursed to the Commissioner of Motor Vehicles from the tax proceeds
received by him, and shall be deducted from any quarterly payment or payments
to be made to the commissioner of finance pursuant to this
agreement. Notes
